  freestar.config = freestar.config || {};

        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="54157" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="54157" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">4.28</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="1146">1,146</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="261"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Greenwich Village</b> by <b>Bond No 9</b> is a Oriental Floral fragrance for women and men. <b>Greenwich Village</b> was launched in 2019. Top notes are Litchi, Cassis and Mandarin Orange; middle notes are Water Lily, Peony and Jasmine; base notes are Ambroxan, Praline, Musk, Vanilla and oak moss. </p><p class="reviewstrigger"                     Some compare it to a toilet cleaner scent
                </div>

class="linkrg"><span title="/board/register.php" class="rtg">Become a member of this online perfume community and you will be able to add your own reviews.</span></p></div></div></div><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_5 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_5" v-pre>
</div></div><div class="cell small-12"><ul class="tabs" data-deep-link="true" data-update-history="true" data-deep-link-smudge="true" data-deep-link-smudge-delay="500" data-tabs id="deeplinked-tabs"><li class="tabs-title is-active"><a href="#all-reviews" aria-selected="true"><svg class="menu" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 20 20" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M10 18a8 8 0 100-16 8 8 0 000 16zm1-12a1 1 0 10-2 0v4a1 1 0 00.293.707l2.828 2.829a1 1 0 101.415-1.415L11 9.586V6z"clip-rule="evenodd"></path></svg>All reviews by date</a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-positive-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></like><span class="show-for-medium">Positive Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-negative-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><dislike style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></dislike><span class="show-for-medium">Negative Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#search-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><i class="fas fa-search"></i><span class="show-for-medium">Search</span></a></li></ul><reviews-wrapper><div class="tabs-content" data-tabs-content="deeplinked-tabs"><div class="tabs-panel is-active" id="all-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2371356" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2371356" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Blossomlove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951646"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1951646.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Blossomlove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Stephane-Humbert-Lucas-777/God-of-Fire-72381.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72381.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="God of Fire"title="God of Fire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2371356ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2371356" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951646">Blossomlove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-12-04"></span><fromunixtime unixtime="1733381834" class="vote-button-legend"></fromunixtime></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think its the oak moss or the cassis that ruins this fragrance for me, its like they took a beautiful fragrance and sucked any and all sweetness and tried to make it as dry as possible. I get zero of the praline note, which I wish I got more of. I thought maybe it just didnt mesh with my chemistry but it does the same thing on my clothes. Its absolutely great for the first 10 seconds and then its like I walked into a musty, moldy basement. If Baccarat was a Riesling, this would be its dry Pinot Grigio counterpart. So if you like this DNA but dont like sweet fragrances, this might be up your alley. For me though, it just misses the mark and the best thing about it is the bottle on my perfume shelf. I would love to try it sans the cassis note and with a bit more of the praline.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2371356"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2371356#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2368126" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2368126" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="victoriabarretta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337079"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1337079.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="victoriabarretta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Oriana-69117.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69117.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oriana"title="Oriana"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2368126ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2368126" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337079">victoriabarretta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-12-02">12/02/24 08:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like Onika by Nicki Minaj. Im so confused about why this is popular.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2368126"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2368126#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2358771" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2358771" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="marietangerine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1463786"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1463786.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="marietangerine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Al-Haramain-Perfumes/Amber-Oud-Rouge-66100.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66100.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amber Oud Rouge"title="Amber Oud Rouge"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2358771ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2358771" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1463786">marietangerine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-23">11/23/24 11:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this. Its fresh, fruity, aquatic and floral. Its pretty and airy with a musky sweetness and a dark green quality. The projection and longevity are strong, sillage is delicate. People compare this to BR540 and Burberry Her, I dont think they smell similar really at all, but the way the sillage carries is similar. That airy ambroxan with a fluffy sweetness that disappears and reappears all day long.<br />
<br />
Gives me strong 90s vibes. Cher from Clueless wears this for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2358771"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2358771#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2356965" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2356965" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kwena._"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1431865"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kwena._" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/La-Vie-Est-Belle-14982.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14982.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Vie Est Belle"title="La Vie Est Belle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2356965ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2356965" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1431865">Kwena._</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-21">11/21/24 17:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Idk whether or not to be mad at myself for blind buying this or be mad at people for overhyping this ( mostly mad at myself but hey) Greenwich village is alright I think its a little overrated. Its Way too green and fresh for my liking, Im more of a gourmand girl and when it comes to freshies I need a bit more sweetness in them. Compared to baccarat, these two dont smell anything alike, only similarity they have is that airy ambroxan base note but I definitely prefer baccarat more. And who ever said that Greenwich village smells like if delina and baccarat had a baby is a liar</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2356965"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2356965#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2351343" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2351343" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="VERYlibby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/737576"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.737576.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="VERYlibby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/Devotion-84951.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84951.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Devotion"title="Devotion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2351343ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2351343" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/737576">VERYlibby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-16">11/16/24 16:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I feel like the color of the bottle is very fitting to the scent and actual notes of this Bond 9. The name seems.. wrong. I definitely don't get Greenwich Village from this scent, I dont think I get anything anywhere in New York from this scent lol but thats just my opinion! Way too green and fresh for me, i really didnt like this. Also see there vanilla listed in the notes which I did not smell. The scent stays around for a very long time though which could makes it worth the price for someone who likes the fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2351343"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2351343#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2339721" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2339721" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Flyloca"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205336"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Flyloca" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2339721ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2339721" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205336">Flyloca</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-06">11/06/24 06:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So, I blindly Purchased this after reading the reviews, thinking I love lychee, I absolutely LOVE Ambroxan (And the original Ambergris) And couldnt wait to smell the melody of all those notes on my skin.<br />
As soon as I let it land on my skin, it definitely smelled green. It smelled like emerald, as how the bottle color is, but then as it developed, I had no idea I was just gonna be buying a revised version of Chanel Allure por femme. <br />
Dont get me wrong, I love Allure. I own it. I have a large bottle that I probably should be using because Ive had it for years and its stowed away in the dark and Ive always thought that fragrance smelled like money. If I want to smell like money, I wear Allure. However, I dont wanna buy again right now and thats what this smells like. <br />
In regards to the BR540 aspect, I can smell the warmth of the Jasmine that is very minimally reminiscent. But because there is no saffron, I cant fully say that it smells like BR540. Overall, I think its nice if I never smelled Allure. But because I know Allure and I own Allure, I dont want it. Im disappointed. I thought it was Going to be different. If I cant return it, Im willing to sell it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2339721"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2339721#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2330739" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2330739" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sssaaammm"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2266711"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2266711.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sssaaammm" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Blazing-Mr-Sam-50255.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50255.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Blazing Mr Sam"title="The Blazing Mr Sam"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2330739ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2330739" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2279046">MillAuraMom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-28">10/28/24 14:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Working on a decant to see if its full bottle worthy for me. The water lily is front and center. Agree it smells like expensive shampoo. I expected a juiciness due to the lychee, mandarin, and rose notes as well as BR comparisons-but I get NONE of that. It shares one note with 540-the one that reminds me of a dry cleaners. It is a tranquil airy spring day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2330437"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2330437#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2326954" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; 9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2326954"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2326954#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2322729" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2322729" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stacyeffect"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1743955"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1743955.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stacyeffect" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54157.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Greenwich Village"title="Greenwich Village"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2322729ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2322729" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1743955">stacyeffect</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-21">10/21/24 08:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im so confused I smelled this at Saks last year and could not get this smell out of my mind, I even had a smelling card and kept bringing it up to my nose for months until I finally ordered last month. Theres no projection, no scent trail and it is not lasting. It almost smells like water(I guess thats the water lilly) but the cassis , litchi , jasmine &amp; vanilla stood out way more at the store. I get the Bacarrat Rouge 540 similarities but Greenwich Village has its own thing going, its more light, more fresh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2322729"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2322729#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2310942" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2310942" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PecanPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281940"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2281940.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PecanPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juliette-Has-A-Gun/Miss-Charming-1714.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1714.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Charming"title="Miss Charming"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2310942ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2310942" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2281940">PecanPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-10">10/10/24 04:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My least favorite Bond of those I've had/tried. Too much ambroxan and ends up feeling way too young for me. The florals never show up to give it any depth, just a fruity ambroxan bomb.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2310942"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2310942#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2305802" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2305802" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stefani valini"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1250908.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stefani valini" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versace/Versace-Pour-Femme-Dylan-Purple-76274.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76274.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Versace Pour Femme Dylan Purple"title="Versace Pour Femme Dylan Purple"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2305802ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2305802" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250908">stefani valini</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-05">10/05/24 10:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Why is it compared to BR540? They are in no way similar... on a tester strip the first two seconds (no more) there is a similar vibe, but it lasts 2 seconds and on paper. I'm really not a fan of BR540. I find it too sweet and medicinal. It doesn't smell bad, but it's not to my liking.<br />
<br />
At first On skin, I didn't like the opening of Greenwich, I was scared. The first minute it was pure ambroxan and oakmoss. I was: "What am I done"(I blind bought it). But it last 1 minute and it settle in to fruity, slightly sweet, fresh and tropical perfume.   <br />
<br />
This one is super fresh and fruity, right up my alley. My favorite notes in perfumery are lychee, peony and vanilla. I like my perfumes when they are well balanced between fruity, floral and fresh. This one gives me everything I love. I am very sensitive to ambroxant, but in this perfume it's just balanced enough and very well nuanced. <br />
<br />
It' a fresh, fruity, slightly aquatic fragrance, with a touch of vanilla praline at the base. It's light, youthfull and airy, perfect for summer. Absolutely beautiful,  complex and very fminin. <br />
<br />
I never blind bought my perfumes, even less at this price, but I did it because I had no way of smelling it and it looked sublime both in the notes and in the reviews. I took a huge risk, which was crowned with success. If you have similar taste as me, you'll probably liking it. Its smells like expensive shampoo</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2305802"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2305802#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2298884" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2298884" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="_willow_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1402559"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1402559.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="_willow_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Black-Opium-25324.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25324.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Opium"title="Black Opium"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2298884ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2298884" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1402559">_willow_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-29">09/29/24 07:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh and fruity lychee, with the subtle yet persistent sweet and spicy ambroxan base. This is a beautiful perfume. While BR540 doesn't own ambroxan, the comparison is warranted. However, this perfume differentiates itself with a distinctly fresh note, aquatic like a calvin klein one. It shifts from the more luxury dinner dress vibe of BR540 to a bougie athleisure vibe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2298884"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2298884#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2295571" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2295571" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="valkyriee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2053372"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2053372.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="valkyriee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2295571ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2295571" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2053372">valkyriee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-26">09/26/24 05:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I didn't like it at all in the beginning, it smelled like some sweet mess at first with a bit of a plasticky cardboard smell. <br />
I got several compliments wearing this one, though, so it does attract people's attention. I was told it smell super yummy. That was the first time ever because usually edible gourmand perfumes aren't really my cup of tea. <br />
I feel like I get some caramel-y whiffs there. My friend smelled me from afar at the train station on a rainy, cold day.<br />
<br />
I do get the fresher aspect on some days, but on other days putting on too much can be too cloying. I do prefer it over BR 540. But aside from being easily likeable by people surrounding you, I don't really get the hype for this one. It's just alright, I am hoping this one will grow on me more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2295571"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2295571#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2288756" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2088088">SeanPaulGoateeHair</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-19">09/19/24 08:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I won't lie maybe i've gone nose blind but this needs like 8 sprays to have good sillage imo, very beautiful fragrance, I don't pick up on the "fishy, cat pissy" cassis, smells fruity and fresh at first, the fruit fades away about 40 mins in, and the fresh lingers and now you really pick up on the florals with a hint of vanilla and a base of fresh musk accompanied by the praline, my most complimented scent ever, would recommend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2285398" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="milano22"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2248459"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="milano22" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2285398ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2285398" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2248459">milano22</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-16">09/16/24 22:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got this in the mail today and wow. Im a college student and this is literally perfect for day and night, completely inoffensive and airy, very juvenile. Perfect for bar nights. I have no idea how ppl say this is cloying because unless you are spraying yourself 15x this will last all day, max 3 sprays and is not gross. Very unisex and smells so much like B540 on me, imagine 540 but cleaner. Thankfully, my skin does not pick up on the florals which are my least favorite note. I do not get fruity on my skin at all, I do get some Litchi in the opening, but barely. I get the praline, and yes this is 100% unisex. If you layer, layer this on top not bottom!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2285398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2285398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2275315" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1906364">Angelus Libri</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-02">09/02/24 09:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What to say about the ubiquitous "BR Accord"? The olfactive tripartite of Jasmine, Oakmoss and Ambrox. I'll echo the sentiment of not everything incorporating those 3 notes into it's composition is an outright dupe. This opens beautifully with a blast of sweet citrus and pissy cassis but the real standout is the well rounded supportive Litchi note that lingers around until the gourmandish dry down takes over. Projects well but like most Ambrox anchored scents I go noseblind almost instantly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2269112"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2269112#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2266408" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293316">Darokes85</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-29">08/29/24 01:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love Bond No 9 fragrances, I really do, but I wish they would RETIRE that cassis note that they use in their fragrances. Every Bond fragrance with cassis in it is ruined by it. Its almost as if theyll made a great fragrance and then say lets fu*k it up with some cassis! Sutton Place, Greenwich Village, Beekman Place, The Scent of Peace for men, ALL ruined by that horrible cassis note bond likes to use! Bond, please stop this madness! PLEASE!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2264436"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2264436#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2263720" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2263720" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rozalina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243220"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1243220.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rozalina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2263720ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2263720" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243220">Rozalina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-28">08/28/24 10:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Greenwich Village smells pink and aquatic with an obviously chemical airiness from the ambroxan. I don't smell BR540 of Burberry Her, just an inoffensively sweet, fresh laundry musk which never veers too close to juvenile territory thanks to the florals and oakmoss.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2263720"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2263720#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2262435" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2262435" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dee97"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1130719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dee97" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2262435ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2262435" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1130719">Dee97</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-27">08/27/24 06:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a love/hate relationship with this fragrance. Most times I can BARELY smell this and even when I do, its not the fresh, fruity, airy scent I remember smelling when I first got my nose on it in Selfridges. However, a lady chased me down the train platform asking what perfume I was wearing as she could smell me from far away. Thats never happened to me before. So clearly some people can smell it. When I ask my friends if they can smell it they say they cant. I barely wear it these days because I feel like whats the point in wearing something I cant smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2262435"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2262435#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2260521" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2260521" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cyclone1391"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/666114"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.666114.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cyclone1391" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2260521ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2260521" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); The ambroxan in both scream on me. And yes there is ambroxan in BR540 Ik that scent when I smell it. The diff is the cassis of this in the opening which is fleeting. I would choose this over BR54 but neither are full bottle worthy for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2260521"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2260521#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2254714" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I literally hate that perfumes cant even have a moment without being compared to it! That being said. If I were to layer this, I would layer it with Lake and Skye 11 11. Its a lighter, upscale big sister to 11 11. I kind of wish it was a hint more sweeter on my skin. Its a very clean , laundry musky scent. I like it enough to sit with it and consider a Full Bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2254714"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2254714#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2250930" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2250930"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2250930#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2249767" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2249767" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dimanta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1430960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1430960.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dimanta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Myrrh-Tonka-42027.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.42027.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Myrrh & Tonka"title="Myrrh & Tonka"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2249767ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2249767" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1430960">Dimanta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-14">08/14/24 20:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such a beautiful and airy feminine scent. I do not find it masculine. At the very beginning it reminded me of Baccarat Rouge and I can still see some similarities in these two perfumes. But Greenwich Village is less in your face, lighter and sexier fragrance. I can definitely smell the litchi, cassis and peony, all the notes are blended so well, so beautiful that it has become my favourite perfume. I think its great for day and evening, all seasons except maybe winter.<br />
The dried down is the same beautiful with one of my favourites ambroxan and musk notes. Love it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2249767"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2249767#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2248598" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349259">LA90036</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-26">07/26/24 19:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is another scent that I love it is an unusual sent lychee in this is beautiful. Its both masculine and feminine. The dry down is very very much exotic. Its sweet without being candy like. Its aThis is another scent that I love it is an unusual sent lychee in this is beautiful. Its both masculine and feminine. The dry down is very very much exotic. Its sweet without being candy like. Its a delicious scent can be worn by anyone</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2230511"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2230511#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2228501" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; After looking up the notes it was further evidence I needed this fragrance because it has litchi in it. I tend to love litchi fragrances..eg Delina, Attrape-Reves, Sparking Lychee... It's fine, and yes, it does remind me of BR540. Like that scent, it also feels a little stale, dishwatery on my skin. Decent longevity and moderate sillage, but it's vastly overpriced for what it is. And to me, the bottles are hideous.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2224637"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2224637#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2223453" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2223453" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="K8lo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1987842"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1987842.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="K8lo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gritti/Duchessa-63729.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63729.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Duchessa"title="Duchessa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2223453ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2223453" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1987842">K8lo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-19">07/19/24 11:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I agree with the person below who said this smells almost medicinal.<br />
<br />
I was SO excited to try Greenwich Village as I have never heard a bad review on her. <br />
First impression: shes so fresh &amp; clean! Slightly fruity. However, the more I sniffed her, the more I fell out of love. I am not a big ambroxan fan (it just immediately gives me the ick). I can smell that synthetic note kicking in on the dry down. She also gets more soapy (which I LOVE a good fresh/musky/shampoo smell). I can definitely see all the magic surrounding her and on the right skin chemistry this would be head turning!<br />
Definitely worth a try if you like fresh, clean, floral, soapy scents and dont mind an ambroxan note!<br />
However to my nose came off a bit antibiotic-esque</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2223453"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2223453#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2222704" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2222704" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="therainman2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2184096"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2184096.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="therainman2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2222704ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2222704" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2184096">therainman2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-18">07/18/24 15:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No this isn`t BR, this is a very unique fragrance. Very versatile, can be worn anytime anywhere basically, the heavy ambroxan gives it around 6 hours of longevity. The projection is decent. Now, i find this WAY overpriced, if you have the money and you like it, great purchase. For me, i don`t see myself spending even remotely close to what this is priced at, but if it was half the price, it would be in consideration for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2222704"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2222704#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2221175" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2221175" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fformoso88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/638972"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.638972.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fformoso88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Madison-Avenue-35956.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35956.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Madison Avenue"title="Madison Avenue"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2221175ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2221175" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/638972">fformoso88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-17">07/17/24 07:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my favorite Bond fragrance. I finally got a full bottle. I didnt love this on paper but on skin its magical! I do get the BR 540 references however this fragrance to my nose stands on its own. To me this is more fruity, sweet, fresh and musky. Its not a dupe but there are similarities there. To me what stands out is a beautiful cloud of sweet musky fruits, with the freshness of the florals and the sexiness of the vanilla/ praline notes. I dont have another fragrance like this in my collection I do also have both BR 540 bottles. This is different enough to justify having all of them actually.  This scent lasts forever and is one of my favorites for spring and summer but you can definitely use year round. Its an easy reach fragrance, a head turner and compliment getter for sure. I love it and highly recommend its very feminine and sexy to me. Love it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2221175"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2221175#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2219879" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
