padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2036950" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KatePal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1957174"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="KatePal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2036950ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2036950" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1957174">KatePal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-20">01/20/24 17:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is a very well-balanced feminine scent without harsh edges. Soapy, beautiful young spring flowers. You are sitting in a bathtub full of bubbles, eating rich vanilla ice cream, and on the stand by the tub is a vase with spring flowers. The perfume is very mildly sweet with a distant coldness of Amboxan that helps the scent stay balanced. It might give out a distant Delina vibe, but not sweet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2036950"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2036950#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2034063" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2034063" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumo67777"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1737177"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1737177.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumo67777" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rasasi/Hawas-for-Him-46890.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46890.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hawas for Him"title="Hawas for Him"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2034063ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2034063" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1737177">perfumo67777</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-17">01/17/24 17:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Greenwich Village by Bond No. 9 and Baccarat Rouge 540 EDP stand as two distinguished fragrances in the realm of luxury scents. While both exude elegance and longevity, they diverge in their scent profiles, with Greenwich Village boasting a more intricate and diverse blend of notes compared to the bold and recognizable combination of saffron, amberwood, and florals in Baccarat Rouge 540. The uniqueness of Greenwich Village may be perceived as an enhancement, providing a memorable olfactory experience that sets it apart. Additionally, some fragrance enthusiasts might favor Greenwich Village for its potential in projection and sillage, creating a more noticeable and lingering scent trail. However, the notion of which fragrance is superior remains subjective, as personal preference and individual body chemistry play integral roles in determining one's olfactory satisfaction. Sampling both allows for a nuanced understanding of their distinct qualities and aids in selecting the fragrance that resonates more profoundly with individual tastes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2034063"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2034063#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2031979" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is a beautiful ambery fragrance with a touch of fruitiness and aquatic florals. So classy and also very addictive. I cant stop sniffing my arm!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2031979"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2031979#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2017204" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2017204" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aramouis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466948"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1466948.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aramouis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Babycat-73149.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73149.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Babycat"title="Babycat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2017204ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2017204" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466948">Aramouis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-01">01/01/24 15:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Greenwich Village (BN9): Yes! Really great summer citrusy scent. Pretty linear, but since I like it, that's a plus. Similar to Scent of Peace For Him, but with louder projection (which is also a good thing). Spring/Summer</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2017204"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2017204#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2015589" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2015589" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dantek121"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1580375"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1580375.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dantek121" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2015589ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2015589" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1580375">dantek121</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-30">12/30/23 17:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Probably my favorite take on the baccarat rouge type/compared fragrances. The added fruity-freshness and reduction of saffron really does it for me. Greenwich Village &gt; Kajal Lamar &gt; Electimuss Trajan &gt; Baccarat Extrait &gt; Tribeca &gt; Baccarat EDP &gt; Armaf Untold &gt; Cloud is my ranking out of what I've tried. This is definitely worth a try for anyone that loves this scent profile.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2015589"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2015589#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2014537" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2014537" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ShayChan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898328"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ShayChan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2014537ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2014537" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898328">ShayChan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-29">12/29/23 16:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I alsk bought into the hype of this fragrance. People online compared it to MFK Baccarat Rouge 540 but I have come to realise that the only thing these have in common is that prominence of Ambroxan. I don't detect the praline , I find it leans a tad masculine, I do get the marine notes though.<br />
Overall, I don't think I would repurchase but I sure am going to where every last drop of it as it cost a pretty penny. <br />
I love MFK BR540, it's still the number one Niche fragrance for me. Mmm that sweet cotton candy, juniper berry and amber never gets old, it's addictive </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2014537"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2014537#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2014465" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882682">Arieeane</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-29">12/29/23 15:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells nothing like bacarrat. Perhaps the depth that baccarat has but theyre nowhere near the same. Its smells wet fruity fresh. The color I get from this is shades of aqua and pink like the bottle funny enough. Very safe to blind buy, its extremely likable and inoffensive. Its feminine and has that signature fragrance appeal because its well blended. Great projection lasts a long time. Very pretty. Theres also a shampoo-ie quality to it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2014465"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2014465#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2008623" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2008623" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GrenadeGirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1633901"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1633901.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GrenadeGirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floraiku/Spring-River-96555.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96555.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spring River"title="Spring River"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2008623ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2008623" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1633901">GrenadeGirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-23">12/23/23 04:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There is such a light, airy, green poolside kinda vibe to this one. A proper spring / summer time stunner! I totally understand why it is pretty universally loved, it is a bit different from the masses, and I don't think ANYONE could find this one offensive, even if you wouldn't actually wear yourself. (Lol, I do actually get the 'toilet cleaner' reference, but it is only the REALLY nicely scented toilet cleaners! :-) ) <br />
<br />
Completely office safe.. it is any time safe... I WOULD call this a safe blind buy, but ..... for whatever reason... on me it is headache inducing. For that reason alone it won't be a full bottle for me, but I genuinely do REALLY like it, so I'll keep a sample on hand and just spray in the air and walk through on odd occasions.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Awesome blend of sweetness, freshness, subtle earthiness, artistic flair, and sexiness. Goes between masculine and feminine notes, creating a cozy harmony. Undeniably pleasing. Its richness evolves smoothly on the skin. Particularly suited for colder days. Versatile, non-linear, complex profile. Exudes a unique effect that instills a sense of individuality and strength. This fragrance resonates deeply with me, hitting all the right notes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="2002150"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=2002150#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1995493" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I really enjoy this, its fresh and airy enough to wear anytime or anywhere. Perfume is subjective but I would wear this mostly in spring. <br />
<br />
I havent seen anyone mention this, but it sort of smells like a luxury inside pool. It has a chlorine ish thing that I cant really describe but smell it often. Lol it doesnt sound that great but its an addicting scent promise!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1988671"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1988671#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1980061" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1980061" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="warmcashmere"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1879178"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1879178.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="warmcashmere" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1980061ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1980061" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1879178">warmcashmere</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-19">11/19/23 05:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When you first spray it, it smells like BR540 for about 2 seconds. Then, it completely changes. It takes on a blue, water-like scent that I think leans more masculine. I don't mind the way it smells on me, but I think I'd like it more on a man. Scent lasts a long time on my skin, which is rare for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1980061"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1980061#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1972420" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1972420" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alambnamedpam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1559874"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1559874.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alambnamedpam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Her-Elixir-de-Parfum-75968.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75968.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Burberry Her Elixir de Parfum"title="Burberry Her Elixir de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1972420ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1972420" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1559874">alambnamedpam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-09">11/09/23 06:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I understand why people think that Greenwich Village has something in common with Baccarat Rouge, but I do not think they are, in practical terms, similar fragrances at all. Like Baccarat, Greenwich Village has a synthetic, vaguely medicinal quality, with a musky undercurrent and some form of sweetness in its base, but they are distant cousins, at best. Greenwich Village has none of the woodiness or spices that are present in Baccarat, and it doesn't smell quite so chemical. Baccarat, on the other hand, is not fresh or light, whatsoever. <br />
<br />
I dislike Baccarat strongly, but I love Greenwich Village. I think it has much closer to a third cousin in the synthetic and medicinal musky family: Burberry Her. Like Her, this fragrance is airy and fruity, but where Her is floral and sweet, Greenwich Village is watery and fresh. <br />
<br />
Of the three, I think that Greenwich Village is the most interesting. It opens with a very fresh, watery, fruity smell, as if you've just stepped out of the shower. The synthetic aspect is there, but doesn't last. The litchi, water lily, and musk however, are persistent throughout the day and keep things airy and bright; it's playful, clean, flirty. Honestly, sophisticated, but with a sense of humour. The longer it wears on your skin, the sweeter and more intimate the smell becomes. The vanilla and praline start to come out, and it becomes more inviting. By morning, everything but the gourmand notes and the musk have faded, so when you wake up, there's still a phantom presence of Greenwich Village that lingers, but only in the form of these final notes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1972420"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1972420#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1971996" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1971996" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dasha11596"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1880169"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="dasha11596" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1971996ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1971996" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1880169">dasha11596</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-08">11/08/23 14:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was the perfume that I have been wanting to smell for such a long time and thought that I would completely adore it. This is actually one of the worst perfume scents that I have smelled. It smells absolutely nothing like BR540, (which it did not seem like it would by the notes) but so many people were saying that it does. Tribeca by Bond no 9 actually smells similar to BR540 but this is nowhere close to it. It actually smells like a bathroom cleaner or something along those lines.... I sprayed it in the air when I first got it and purposely didn't spray it on myself but I kept getting whiffs of it throughout the day on myself and every time I did it grossed me out. This perfume really disappointed me but I'm glad I did not buy a full size. I tried to smell it again the next day and immediately had the same reaction so I will have to give the sample away.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1971996"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1971996#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1964810" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1964810" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="J0Vaughn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1778819"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="J0Vaughn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1964810ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1964810" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1778819">J0Vaughn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-30">10/30/23 23:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first spray there was something amazing being produced that carried on hours later even through transition and a transformation. I see why some might say Baccarat 540 is the slightly casting deep vibes However, by no stretch of the imagination are they the same or a close comparison. Greenwich is sophisticated chic sweet. 540 is more hardened, deep, and has hints of masculinity. Both are unisex but Greenwich is worn by someone commanding attention, its sexy. 540 is alluring but not sexy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1964810"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1964810#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1960129" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1960129" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Yolis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1341217"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1341217.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Yolis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1960129ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1960129" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1341217">Yolis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-24">10/24/23 21:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>IDK whether it's the cassis (which is kinda sharp), jasmine (which I understand can be indolic and almost pissy), ambroxan, or oak moss or maybe a mix of them but something is OFF. But it starts off medicinal spicy weirdly mens cologney and almost garlic to me? Like I got it on my hands and despite washing them like 4 times with dish soap and bathroom soap it smells vaguely sharp and garlicky. That ambroxan is putting in work, I did not go anosmic to it at all. An hour in the overt sharpness was pretty mellowed out. <br />
<br />
Ive never tried BR540 or Cloud so I cant say if this smells like them, but Im assuming the medicinal scent is what binds the 3 together. It is definitely an aquatic floral (think bathroom cleaner) with a SHARP opening. I am not a fan of sweet scents (the exception being Killians LDBS) but I LOVE floral scents and know I love lychee, praline, and musk so I decided to give it a shot. I completely understand the baby vomit, recently cleaned toilet, and medicinal latex glove that reviewers before me said they smelt. I dont understand the pina colada, desert like, or fresh clean sweet floral comparisons. I was really hoping for a pretty fresh floral lychee praline type musk that I could just throw on whenever and this did not work.<br />
<br />
Overall, it seems like people are very divided on this scent. I was ready to love it and now that I've tried it I can say that this is NOT blind buy friendly, you really need to get a sample to test it out on your skin. <br />
<br />
If this perfume were a person it'd be House M.D.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1960129"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1960129#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1957886" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1957886" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SwavScent12"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1426998"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1426998.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="SwavScent12" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/WIDIAN/London-47781.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47781.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="London"title="London"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1957886ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1957886" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1426998">SwavScent12</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-21">10/21/23 18:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Weird how this has so many votes as a summer fragrance. Definitely not the case. Beautiful winter time fragrance</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1957886"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1957886#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1933189" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1933189" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nbazza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379491"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nbazza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1933189ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1933189" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379491">nbazza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-20">09/20/23 20:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It did slightly remind me of cloud, but I will not offend it like that. It's still unique.<br />
This is done beautifully, and I agree there is something interesting like burnt rubber but it is beautifully mixed with fruits, florals and the ambroixian with some sweetness. In lovely Bond fashion there are unexpected notes mixed together - this is what clever perfme is all about sometimes!<br />
The litchi is not strong like it is in delina, and it does not smell like bureberry her to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1933189"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1933189#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1932367" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1932367" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NB99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1206085"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1206085.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NB99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Roses-Vanille-15210.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15210.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Roses Vanille"title="Roses Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1932367ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1932367" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1206085">NB99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-19">09/19/23 22:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dude!  This DOES NOT resemble BR 540 OR Delina (or cloud, or burberry her).  Maybe because it's light and airy?  I'm a little disappointed because I was actually hoping it would resemble the two.  But it DOES NOT.  I swear, it must be the power of suggestion that convinces people of such nonsense.  <br />
<br />
That being said, it's a beautiful fragrance.  It's a floral scent with a hint of fruit &amp; vanilla.  What makes it super interesting is that the ambroxan and oak moss adds the tiniest hint of burnt rubber smell in the mix (at least to my nose) and weirdly, I like it.  But the rubber goes away after a few minutes and it dries down to a light airy vanilla floral.  It's quite pretty.  I'm not sure if it's worth the price.<br />
<br />
Scent: 8.5/10<br />
Projection: 3/10<br />
Longevity: 2/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1932367"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1932367#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1931634" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1931634" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wavygod"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1391733"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1391733.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wavygod" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1931634ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1931634" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1391733">wavygod</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-19">09/19/23 03:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I dont understand how anyone doesnt pick up BR540 in this or TriBeCa. Its not in your face like TriBeCa but it definitely creeps in. This is a fresher, fruiter, slightly less medicinal take of BR540.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1931634"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1931634#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1910492" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1910492"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1910492#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1910173" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1910173" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lamerienda"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35155"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35155.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lamerienda" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byron-Parfums/Mula-Mula-50711.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50711.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mula Mula"title="Mula Mula"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1910173ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1910173" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35155">lamerienda</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-24">08/24/23 04:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like extrait of Victorias Secret model! <br />
<br />
Also, what others mentioned:<br />
Ultimate Barbie scent: Yes!<br />
Water rides at Disneyland: Yes!<br />
BR540: Thankfully, not even close.<br />
Burberry Her: GV is more musky, vanillic and also the jasmine note gives a depth to it.<br />
Compliment magnet: Yes! <br />
<br />
It lasts and projects!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1910173"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1910173#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1910138" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1910138" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amgenus2015"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1656684"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1656684.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amgenus2015" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/Orchidee-Vanille-6463.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6463.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orchidee Vanille"title="Orchidee Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1910138ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1910138" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1656684">amgenus2015</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-24">08/24/23 03:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such a yummy fragrance. The Baccarat Rouge comparisons are inaccurate - this is a completely different fragrance. It reminds me of a more complex version of Daisy Dream, with traces of Taunt by Dedcool.<br />
<br />
I have a feeling I love litchi - I get that watery fruit scent coming through on top, but it is balanced out with warmer scents too (I think the vanilla and ambroxan). I really love the combination of fresh/watery/green and warm/sweet/soft. It is something I have been craving, but didnt realize it was exactly what I was looking for until now.<br />
<br />
In the bottle I did smell the sharper green notes, so Im happy this works well with my skin chemistry and dries down into a scent I really enjoy. <br />
<br />
I could wear this on a fun daytime date with my boyfriend, or to work, or to hang out in the park with the girls. Its a fun shopping fragrance too if you want to feel like that girl. Clean and inviting.<br />
<br />
Update: I dont find myself reaching for this one often. Something about it feels cloying to me even though the overall vibe is aromatic and clean.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1910138"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1910138#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1901880" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1518674">noneya88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-14">08/14/23 07:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's airy like BR540 but fruity and very feminine.  It does kind give Her vibes but it's much more refined than Her.  I like the opening and mid much more than the dry down though. <br />
 About 6 hours in and the scent that's lingering smells too much like Versace Dylan Purple.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1901880"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1901880#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1894272" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1894272" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="angel1120"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1268115"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1268115.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="angel1120" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escada/Sorbetto-Rosso-47255.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47255.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sorbetto Rosso"title="Sorbetto Rosso"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1894272ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1894272" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1268115">angel1120</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-04">08/04/23 13:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume has taken me on a wild ride. This is my first foray into Bond fragrances. I first sampled it at the counter after reading positive reviews. I thought it smelled pleasant on paper, nothing to write home about. I sprayed it on my skin to see how I felt about it throughout the day. Omg!! I just kept going back to sniffing my wrist over and over. When the breeze hit me and I smelled the perfume again, I was wondering what smelled so good. I even had a dream about this perfume. Sounds dramatic, I know. A few days later I went and splurged on the full size. Best way I could describe this scent is like an aquatic, fresh, summery version of Burberry Her. I do own Burberry Her, but this is much better and has so much more depth. To me, this is like a sophisticated tropical scent. Long lasting, sometimes I can still smell hints of it even after Ive showered.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1894272"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1894272#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1887187" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Well, the excitement jumped to another level after its first spray. But bro, its way too pricey and I always look for pocket-friendly versions if I start loving any expensive fragrance. I tried The Village Of Green by DUA, and Oh Man, This fragrance is made for me!!! Can never go wrong with Amber floral scent + vanilla notes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1887187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1887187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1887163" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I would wear this for sure. It's fruity and floral with a hint of the caramel. If you're looking between this and Tribeca, know that this doesn't smell like pure sugar like Tribeca. This is definitely fresher and greener. Way more depth here and peaks interest. I really like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1887163"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1887163#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1885730" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1885730" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sophia97"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1670870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sophia97" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versace/Bright-Crystal-Absolu-21547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bright Crystal Absolu"title="Bright Crystal Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1885730ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1885730" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); But when I smelled, my god it became my new favorite. It's little sweet, aquatic, fresh and magical. But one sad thing is the price, no matter how magical and heavenly it smells, it's too expensive for me. I'm just here looking for it's dupe, please help your girl out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1885730"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1885730#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1882608" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I dont completely agree with the comparisons with BR540 except the airy nature of the fragrance. Greenwich Village is much better in terms quality and smell. BR540 edp  concentration has that dentist office thing going on. Greenwich Village is more natural smelling with fruity deliciousness whilst still maintaining that airy nature. <br />
<br />
Perfect for the summer but strong enough to be worn year round. Leans slightly feminine but id have no problem rocking this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1862175"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1862175#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1860500" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1850035" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Xela_529"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1545982"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1545982.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Xela_529" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ella-K-Parfums/Melodie-D-Altai-48471.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48471.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Melodie D'Altai"title="Melodie D'Altai"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1850035ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1850035" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1545982">Xela_529</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-05">06/05/23 22:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Theres something nostalgic about Greenwich Village.. Yes, she has a similar DNA to BR540. But something interesting and magical happens in the dry-down she smells like water rides at Disney World! (Hence, magical lol, Its a small world, the Mexican ride at Epcot, etc). Does anyone else experience this? Oddly enough, Ive heard of people making that comparison with BR540, but I only get it with GV. <br />
<br />
GV is fresh, aquatic, slightly sweet. Im not sure if shes full bottle worthy for me, personally. Im going to start with a travel size for when I want to smell that nostalgic scent from my childhood lol.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1850035"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1850035#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1846224" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1846224" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LNicole"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1713128"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1713128.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LNicole" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1846224ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1846224" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1713128">LNicole</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-31">05/31/23 20:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>GV is my most complimented fragrance in my collection. Fresh, airy, fruity, aquatic, non offensive goodness. This fragrance is office, gym, and practically every occasion safe. I receive most compliments at the gym after a full day of work, as my skin warming up seems to jumpstart GV back to life. <br />
<br />
I also layer GV with Molecule 01 or Molecule 02 to extend the longevity and ramp up projection. Give it a try, you wont be disappointed and the compliments will flow nonstop!<br />
<br />
Scent: 10/10<br />
Longevity: 8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1846224"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1846224#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1834439" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1834439" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="islandgirlmaranda"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1255474"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1255474.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="islandgirlmaranda" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Aqua-Allegoria-Nettare-di-Sole-66360.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66360.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Allegoria Nettare di Sole"title="Aqua Allegoria Nettare di Sole"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1834439ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1834439" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1255474">islandgirlmaranda</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-16">05/16/23 09:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just received my samples...<br />
I have to say as soon as I smelled them I said...I know this smell. This is Zara Red Temptation Summer Edition. This is smoother and you can tell it's top quality. But is it worth owning both? I sprayed my arms liberally this morning at 7:30am. It's now 12:20pm and I can still smell it. I did get a, "You smell good!" This morning when I got to work. But they always say that because I am the perfume girl in the office. I'll do a side by side test today and see if it's an exact dupe.<br />
<br />
Update: it's definitely not a dupe. Red Temptation Summer is lighter and more airy and almost more sharp. GV is way more smooth, soft, floral, and dare I say buttery. I vote GV over RTS.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1834439"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1834439#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1834344" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399182">LeslieM</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-12">05/12/23 20:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Will never be without this fragrance. I didn't understand the hype when I tried it at the store but I kept thinking about it so eventually bought a bottle.  I can't ever get enough of this. I try not to use it too much because I want to use so many of my other lovely scents, but this is an easy reach for me. I get compliments every time I wear this and it leaves a deliciously fresh scent trail.  I have the most love for this scent when I haven't worn it for a minute. It's like I fall in love with it all over again. There is nothing else in my collection like GV. To my nose this does not smell like BR540 and I don't get the comparisons. If anything Tribeca from Bond has a slight similarity on first spray only. But that beast is an incredible creation of its own.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1831780"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1831780#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1827959" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
