I smell no comparsion in skin to Baccarat ..Remember skin chemistry plays a big part I smell fresh a bit green slightly fruity with a hint if musk following behind. I like her better in fall more sweeter on my skin. In spring/summer the green fresh notes pop more. Vacation or Baecation test on skin first never judge by someone else views.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1827959"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1827959#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1825328" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1825328" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="looraw"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1438301"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1438301.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="looraw" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Regime-des-Fleurs/Chloe-Sevigny-Little-Flower-56715.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56715.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chlo Sevigny Little Flower"title="Chlo Sevigny Little Flower"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1825328ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1825328" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1438301">looraw</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-05">05/05/23 03:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A juicy lychee with a rich and sweet underlay - kind of tropical creamsicle-ish! Conjures vague associations with misc barbie dolls and plastic blow up pool dolphins. This is such a modern scent, but it also gives off an early 2000s millennial vibe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1825328"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1825328#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1819829" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1819829" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Allthingssparkle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1523254"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1523254.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Allthingssparkle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1819829ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1819829" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1523254">Allthingssparkle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-28">04/28/23 05:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I finally got a sample of this.  My first impression, even before reading reviews, was BR540 + Burberry Her.  It's like they had a baby.  It feels like it's partly one thing and partly another -- and winds up being a little annoying to me.  Like I sprayed hairspray on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1819829"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1819829#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1815789" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1815789" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kate_the_Iris"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1734129"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1734129.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kate_the_Iris" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1815789ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1815789" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1734129">Kate_the_Iris</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-23">04/23/23 14:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Three words can describe this perfume PINAPPLE  COCONUT  OVERPRICED. A great pina colada in the bottle. <br />
<br />
Last week went to Germany to search for this fragrance as in Austria this brand is not present. But 450 euros for a bottle? What is inside? And the packaging is not even as sophisticated as in other brands like Guerlain, for example, which engraves your name on the bottle (and within 300 euros). The bottle feels cheap, like those 30 euro ones you can get in mass cosmetics stores. Nothing even remotely sophisticated. I am yet to figure out what makes it so expensive. <br />
<br />
The scent  nice, yes, warm, yes, summery, yes (but also smells a bit synthetic). Smells like you are sipping a pina colada on the sunny beach somewhere in the Caribbeans. AND like those self-tanning lotions (or after sun lotions). Since I have used plenty, I can tell you for sure IT IS THAT VERY SMELL. I dont mind the association, but I am afraid the people around me will not recognise this is a niche perfume, but would think I have some 10 euro lotion on. <br />
<br />
I would love to wear it in the summer when I am on vacation. But I would buy BR540 and a flight ticket to the beach for this price instead.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1815789"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1815789#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1806238" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1806238" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cdcs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188872"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cdcs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Narcotic-Delight-89368.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89368.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narcotic Delight"title="Narcotic Delight"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1806238ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1806238" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188872">cdcs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-11">04/11/23 12:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Quite pleasant. Not my usual scent profile, but I don't mind wearing it. Has the BR540 DNA, especially of how it's trail smells, but mixed with pronounced white flowers that aren't screechy or too loud and bothersome and fruity top notes. Quite fresh and not something I'd usually gravitate towards, but I recieved a free sample of it and was surprised with how pleasant I found it, and I know I'm wearing all of my free sample. To me it's a mix of Baccarat's trail, clean skin that just showered with luxurious white flowers scented soap, topped with fresh fruity and light moisturizer and high end sunscreen. Sounds a bit strange, but it's very pleasant and reminds me of going on vacation on a really nice, luxurious tropical place with very few people (which I just did, so it's a fun experience to remember). I usually gravitate towards darker scents and am not really that into fruity or "sunny" daytime perfumes, so it's a big surprise that I not only don't hate it, but I actually enjoy wearing it even tough this would usually be the antithesis of what I tend to wear haha. Very likable, reminds me of drinking wine/beer on a motorboat with my family and eating really sweet tropical fruits! Lasts really well on my skin and has an okay projection, but not as big as I usually wear. I was surprised to see how many people hated it though, my first though was that this was a very safe blind buy if you enjoy the profile, but apparently not. I myself didn't get any of the bad stuff described here though, but if I do I'll be sure to update. But for now it's a strong like even though I won't be buying it, because I know I won't gravitate towards the bottle as often enough to justify owning it. And though it leans a bit young (mid 20's, not a highschooler scent) because it's so fresh and fun, it would smell great on all ages!! I would love to smell this on anyone at all, old, young, male, female, anything in between! Very fresh, fun, maybe a bit flirty and absolutely lovely!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1806238"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1806238#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1806114" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1792031" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cocototo26"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244196"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1244196.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cocototo26" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1792031ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1792031" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244196">Cocototo26</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-25">03/25/23 00:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Guys this scent is just beautiful and super super likeable. Since it was a blind buy I was a little worried because I am not really a fan of BR540. But GV is fresh, sweet and juicy but a good performer. I get the comparison but to be honest GV is the more likeable one. On my skin I get mostly cassis,  peony, litchi, musk and what I am guessing is ambroxan.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1792031"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1792031#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1790597" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1790597" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SolidSackTime"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410522"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1410522.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SolidSackTime" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1790597ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1790597" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); What a mistake! I love all of the notes, but it goes totally baby vomit on my skin :( <br />
Beautiful bottle and presentation. No knock on the company, I think its the lychee is whats bad on my skin. <br />
The praline and ambroxian I can detect are really pretty in this. <br />
Longevity is good (not great for me trying to scrub it off!).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1790597"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1790597#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1785074" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1785074" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="funnycolorliquid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/401671"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="funnycolorliquid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Elevator-Music-48821.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48821.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elevator Music"title="Elevator Music"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1785074ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1785074" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/401671">funnycolorliquid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-16">03/16/23 12:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like a plastic barbie on vacation at the most expensive spa on a tropical island. <br />
<br />
So clean, so fresh. Perfect <br />
<br />
UPDATE: Bought a full bottle and I'm sad to report that it doesn't last on my skin. I am in love with the scent but longevity and sillage are very disappointing. Not worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1785074"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1785074#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1784514" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1784514" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Stoopid Phresh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1488415"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1488415.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Stoopid Phresh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1784514ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1784514" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); I did a review of this a few weeks ago (see below) where I spoke about this guy following me to my desk to ask me what colonge I was wearing &amp; it was this. I gave him a 2ml decant &amp; I told him to give me feedback...WELL I GOT THE FEEDBACK <br />
"Hey man, this stuff had random women sniffing on me while I was with my girl lol, my girlfriend was looking at them women crazy as fck but bro, ppl were going crazy tellin me I smell nice, bro this is a dope ass fragrance and it's my new favorite" <br />
Those were his exact words </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1784514"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1784514#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1784101" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1784101" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tiffaniday81"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1602161"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="tiffaniday81" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1784101ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1784101" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1602161">tiffaniday81</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-15">03/15/23 10:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Gorgeous scent.  That beast mode vibe that most are looking for from BR540, Greenwich produces.  It does not smell exactly like BR540, but here or there you get a whiff that is reminiscent of it, but the volume has been turned up, and then mellowed back out with the vanilla.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; I never fall in love like this with any fragrance. This is my baby.  <br />

<br />
Edit: It started making me feel nauseous, I had to get rid of it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1782320"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1782320#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1782283" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1782283" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="halex"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1424253"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="halex" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Mon-Guerlain-43297.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43297.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mon Guerlain"title="Mon Guerlain"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1782283ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1782283" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1424253">halex</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-13">03/13/23 06:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh man. I didnt want to like this. I finally had the chance to try it, andI fell in love. Sigh. <br />
<br />
On first spray, its not great. Lets be real. It smells exactly like others say: cheap perfume-y toilet cleaner. Reminiscent of mall perfumes from the mid 2000s. (Due to this, I was hopeful Id hate it.)<br />
<br />
Then the magic happens. The dry down turns it into an addictive, sweet/fresh floral/sugary situation, then the mossy woodsy bits come through gradually, getting stronger and stronger. Yes, theres a medicinal smell. Yes, I LOVE that smell. Usually I associate the bandaid smell with BR540 type scents, so its unusual to my nose to smell it blended with fruity florals. <br />
<br />
Its as if all those sweet perfumes we wore as teen millennials matured and grew into a fabulous, well-dressed, wealthy woman. Its all at once relatable and enigmatic. <br />
<br />
The price point is outrageous, but for some, thats part of the appeal, Im sure. <br />
<br />
As for me, Ill be keeping my eye on sales. I want it, I love it, but not at the original price point!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1782283"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1782283#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1778566" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1778464" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PerfumePixie87"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1563263"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1563263.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PerfumePixie87" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/What-We-Do-Is-Secret/Messy-Sexy-Just-Rolled-out-of-Bed-40574.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40574.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Messy Sexy Just Rolled out of Bed"title="Messy Sexy Just Rolled out of Bed"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1778464ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1778464" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1563263">PerfumePixie87</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-08">03/08/23 13:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I dont get much of the floral or fruity notes. Its very sweet and airy, it has a translucence about it that stops it being too sickly but it is very sweet. I get mainly praline, ambroxan and musk. I felt based on reviews I would love this but it doesn't quite resonate with me, it's possibly too sweet for my tastes. I havent tested it thoroughly enough but I imagine its a compliment magnet. Super feminine and girly but I feel very pricey for this sort of sugary unsophisticated DNA.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1778464"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1778464#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1776931" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1488415">Stoopid Phresh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-06">03/06/23 21:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I came through the office with this on and a guy followed me to my desk to ask me what I was wearing...This is mass appealing like a mofo &amp; it has monstrous sillage! This is a nice  vanilla floral that hits so hard!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1776931"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1776931#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1775286" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1775286" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="memorialea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1699765"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="memorialea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1775286ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1775286" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1699765">memorialea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-04">03/04/23 22:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent really grew on me and has me reaching for it more and more. When I first spray it on, theres a sharp scent Im not particularly fond of and had me thinking this may not be the fragrance for me. BUT once its dries down- I really love it. Its a warm, soft, summery, airy, clean and comforting after it dries down. Great for spring and summer!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1775286"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1775286#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1772433" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1772433" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Apaolone04"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596253"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1596253.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Apaolone04" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Omnia-Profumi/Madera-9534.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9534.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Madera"title="Madera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1772433ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1772433" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596253">Apaolone04</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-01">03/01/23 14:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my favorite perfume I own. If it didnt cost so much itd be my signature scent, but I love just reaching for the bottle and smelling the cap because it makes me happy. The base is pretty generic, like a soapy creamy sweet floral but with a refined and airy touch that separates it from the rest. Theres a beautiful aquatic note to this as well. I couldnt think of another scent like this one. The peony sticks out the most to me, along with the ambroxan. Doesnt last too long on my skin, maybe 4 hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1772433"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1772433#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1771515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1764657" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Phresh Man"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290157"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1290157.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Phresh Man" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1764657ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1764657" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1290157">Phresh Man</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-20">02/20/23 08:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This doesn't smell like Baccarat at all... Please stop with the bandwagon reviews! This premium scent smells like a floral, vanilla bomb! This scent has monstrous silliage! I love to wear this scent with my aqua polos. The vanilla &amp; floral notes come together so well...the fruits keep this scent less dense than Baccarat Rouge which is heavier. Baccarat Rouge smells like big red chewing gum on steroids! This is very playful and pleasing to the nose-</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1764657"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1764657#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1753815" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1753815" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="juliemotlagh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1175159"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1175159.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="juliemotlagh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giardini-Di-Toscana/Blu-Indaco-64760.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64760.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blu Indaco"title="Blu Indaco"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1753815ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1753815" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1175159">juliemotlagh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-06">02/06/23 21:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Okay...this is absolutely nothing...and I mean nothing like baccarat rouge 540.  But it is an amazing floral and a bit fruity.  It has a fresh a summery feel but I also get a warm and more wintery mix.  Tribeca is way closer to BR540 than Greenwich could ever be.  All that said, this is a such a fresh and feminine scent.  I absolutely love it and it instantly made it to my top 5.  That says a lot considering I have over 150 bottles.  <br />
<br />
Now for a public service announcement...if you like this scent, try the new Sospiro called Dolce Melodia.  It is one heck of a damn good scent...still feminine and a bit softer and more wearable.  It is going to be a popular one.  I found it on Nicheglam.com as well as other harder to find scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1753815"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1753815#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1747788" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1747788" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nanaa_from_ghana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509671"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nanaa_from_ghana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1747788ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1747788" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509671">nanaa_from_ghana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-30">01/30/23 20:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I usually like to write long extensive reviews for fragrances but this is such a nice, uncomplicated scent that can be worn literally whenever. I havent tried too many of the other scents coming out of this house, but after coming across this one, I feel theres no need. This is one of the nicest fresh scents Ive come across. I wont lie I was scared when I saw that oakmoss note, but my nose barely picks it up. Its perfectly sweet and light, but has a presence and can stand on its own. Im definitely gonna get a full bottle of this. I see the comparisons to BR540, but only in the first minute of the scent being sprayed. They both have a weird, medicinal opening, but then dry down into gorgeous and differentiable scents. <br />
<br />
Yes, Greenwich Village is really expensive, but I think its worth every penny.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1747788"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1747788#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1745194" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Initially, on first spray, there is some resemblance to BR540. If you like Delina la rosee, you will like this. I don't think its worth the huge price tag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1745194"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1745194#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1741500" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1741500" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pioneer9000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1492149"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1492149.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pioneer9000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1741500ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1741500" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1492149">pioneer9000</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-23">01/23/23 13:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful soft sweet scent. I like this more than BR540 I think.. probably unisex but leans more fem imo!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1741500"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1741500#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1732699" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1732699" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bryan5610SLBL"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242678"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1242678.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bryan5610SLBL" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1732699ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1732699" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242678">Bryan5610SLBL</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-12">01/12/23 20:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells amazing. Fresh, uplifting, unique, and totally unisex. First night I wore it I received two compliments right after walking into the restaurant. Lasts about 4 - 6 hours. Others have mentioned that it smells like Baccarat Rouge 540, which I also own. I dont get the comparison at all. I would recommend getting a decant before purchasing due to the price. But I think its totally worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1732699"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1732699#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1724325" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1724325" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amanda0727"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1583049"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="amanda0727" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Guidance-78656.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78656.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Guidance"title="Guidance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1724325ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1724325" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1583049">amanda0727</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-03">01/03/23 15:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Now that I have sniffed BR540 I can positively say that this is just BR540 with added lictchi &amp; citrus notes. I returned this a while ago because I cant stand the BR540 smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1724325"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1724325#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1723781" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1723781" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dbun"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1572157"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1572157.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dbun" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Liquides-Imaginaires/Blanche-Bete-70189.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70189.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blanche Bte"title="Blanche Bte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1723781ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1723781" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1572157">Dbun</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-03">01/03/23 03:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yum! To my nose this is a super fresh and fruity fragrance. I generally dont prefer fresh scents but I do love this one, it smells like I just showered all day - when I sniff myself I feel super clean and yummy at the same time. Longevity is great, I can spray before heading out and still smell myself after 7 hours. I can wear this on any occasion at any time in any weather and I feel as though it would be appropriate. Its very inoffensive and safe to me but at the same time super posh and elevated. Eg: I can wear this when walking my dog, and feel like a lululemon model, or wear it out to dinner and feel like a clean girl. <br />
<br />
I can understand how people compare this to BR because theres a certain airiness to it, however I think theyre 2 distinctively different fragrances. I also believe this leans more feminine but I can imagine smelling this on a man.  <br />
<br />
For an ultra yummy experience I like to use this in conjunction with Sol De Janeiros Bom Dia Bright line - they have similar vibes but SDJ is much more sweet and feminine. Ill use their body wash, then the lotion, then spray Greenwich Village - get ready for a boatload of compliments.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1723781"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1723781#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1722708" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1722708" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amrandcoco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1261504"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1261504.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amrandcoco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chloe/Chloe-Eau-de-Parfum-1733.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1733.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chlo Eau de Parfum"title="Chlo Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1722708ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1722708" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1261504">amrandcoco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-01">01/01/23 17:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me this is different than BR 540 but are in the same family.  It is like BR 540 and a lovely tropical-floral aquatic had a baby.  Its not like some aquatics that are often pure floral with water notes but is more like a "sweet buttery floral aquatic"? I have no idea how to describe that smell other than it turns out absolutely lovely when combined together.   It has the candy like bubble that surrounds a floral on vacation in the tropics all mingling together.  I do get the BR540 vibes because of the little wisps you get of the vanilla candy like smell in the background but then this one is so much more.  It adds some of my favorite notes like water lily, litchi and peony.  I found to my surprise based on comments for many floral aquatics, that they are not popular with so many people and can easily be in their hate category.  I just love them so I can't relate, but perhaps I can suggest this is not a "loud sharp aquatic"?.  It is rather like a safe and soft tropical floral with no harshness to my nose.  I also appreciate a well done gourmand with notes I like but it takes something special to turn my head on these as I mostly reach for something like Delina Rose.  This is having the best of both worlds and will most likely please those that love their candy gourmand perfumes and those that love the wonder of a well blended tropical-like water floral.  I do not feel this has a gender and is definitely a head turner when worn so prepare for other's curiosity.  <br />
  Probably one of the best things for me on this one is that I do not go nose blind and can smell it on me for hours.  I wear perfume for me so smelling it on me is a must.  I discovered to my dismay I get nose blind to BR 540 after about an hour but one spray of the extrait added on and it is fixed for the most part.  I wish I would have invested in this one before going crazy for BR 540 and trying dupes only to settle on getting the big bottle of BR 540 then the red bottle too during my honeymoon phase with BR540. I enjoy owning BR 540, the extrait and Greenwich.  I see them different enough to each other in various ways and one can't outright replace the other.  They all are notable works of art for their own reasons in perfume no doubt which can clearly be observed by their huge popularity along with many inspiration perfumes that followed.  Pure curiosity and lack of understanding exactly what the notes together would smell like got the best of me on BR 540 a few years ago so I caved and sampled.  As with many before me, it was a love that led to looking for more 540-like perfumes.  After lurking the comments for over a year, I also have jumped on the Greenwich Village popularity boat finally.  I will say it was worth the leap and I am loving the ride for now. Some days I reach for my BR 540 mix or a floral favorite but most days lately, it is Greenwich for now (still on honeymoon ).  No, I do not like the price either but I can't find anything like it out there so I can't suggest anything reasonable. <br />
 I have to recommend trying before buying to save one from the dreaded expensive blind buy fail.  It might not meet everyone's expectations.  Undoubtably, it will never please everyone as no perfume will ever please us all and thats why I appreciate reading comments from those that have took a leap of faith before me or properly tested.  However I must admit, I blind bought this as I tend to blind buy due to almost no places to test in my location along with impulsive, patience-less, curiosity that I have not learned to tame yet despite many fails.  So for those of you that like the vibes this type of perfume gives and can relate to it's fans based on their favorites, I don't see a reason to stop a blind buy for those willing to roll the dice.  I can't see this "offending" anyone but I wouldn't overspray as it has a nice projection and sillage as a perfume should but usually don't these days ----unfortunately.  <br />
Thank you everyone for continuing to contribute your own experience with your perfumes here.  I find reading so many of the noses-that-know as well as the simple perfume-lover comments helpful in discovering a new perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1722708"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1722708#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1714512" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1714512" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="handkmommy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1248294"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1248294.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="handkmommy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Phlur/Missing-Person-72665.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72665.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Missing Person"title="Missing Person"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1714512ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1714512" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1248294">handkmommy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-21">12/21/22 17:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This has got the sweet notes of Mancera Instant Crush and BR 540. But it has a greenness to it. A little masculine at first. Women can certainly wear it, but I think Id prefer it on a man. The green aspect is almost like foliage. Its odd, but its also oddly good.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1714512"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1714512#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1705237" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1692132" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Heavenly Heather"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317582"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1317582.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Heavenly Heather" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1692132ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1692132" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317582">Heavenly Heather</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-19">11/19/22 20:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Big time BR 540 vibes coming from this one! However, theres a freshness and slight sweetness in Greenwich Village that makes it different enough. This feels more casual to me as well. Definitely unisex and would make a great everyday signature scent. Great lasting power too!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1692132"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1692132#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1684825" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1682187" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="coffeebean83"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1560657"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1560657.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="coffeebean83" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1682187ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1682187" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1560657">coffeebean83</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-06">11/06/22 03:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a interesting mix that I very much enjoy.  I get a aquatic-marine and pineapple vibe from this(must be part of the tropical accord with combo of notes).  It's like you're eating a pineapple desert(the praline coming through) outside at a portside restaurant.  It settles into the base notes(oak moss here is quite noticeable) while still keeping this vibe.   <br />
Smells nothing like Bac540 imo.  Two totally different note profiles and vibes.<br />
GV is definitely a spring/summer fragrance.  Could possible work for fall too if just a little out of it's element.   Last great and projects moderately.   It's a love for me. :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1682187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1682187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1679694" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Its almost a whisper but you can still smell the trail in the air. I dont think this smells like BR540. If they were related, theyd be distant distant cousins, and even so, Greenwich Village is much fresher and fruitier. Less sensual and more daytime than BR540</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1679694"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1679694#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1675429" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
