padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1535481">AlinkaSun</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-27">10/27/22 09:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I understand the hype around this perfume. I love it! It is such a light, aquatic and aromatic scent. Its perfect for everyday use, not offensive, office appropriate but still very unique and not boring. It is a perfect balance between sweet and freshespecially in dry down. I get water lily, just a little bit of jasmine, peony and a lot of praline and vanilla  but I am pretty sure that musk is what balances out this sweetness. Magnificent! So well done and blended to perfection! Love for life!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1675429"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1675429#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1669896" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1669896" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JamesGamez"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521295"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1521295.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JamesGamez" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1669896ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1669896" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521295">JamesGamez</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-19">10/19/22 19:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>LOVE THIS. Its fruity, airy, slightly sweet, and fresh. Theres a plasticky vibe going on in the background but isnt a bother. This is perfect for summer/spring. <br />
<br />
Longevity, and Projection is 10/10.  I received two compliments on the first day of wearing this.<br />
<br />
Update: Finally got a 100ml, and the body silk! The body silk smells strong, and exactly like the fragrance, but its a little bit more vanilla based.<br />
This is a compliment getter 100%.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1669896"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1669896#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1630701" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1630701" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="oluchifriend"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1557628"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="oluchifriend" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1630701ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1630701" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1557628">oluchifriend</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-24">08/24/22 19:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me, I love the airiness of it and it lasts far longer than Baccarat Rouge on my skin. If anyone is selling a bottle in the US, let me know!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1630701"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1630701#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1624339" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1624339" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Perpetual Collector"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297099"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1297099.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Perpetual Collector" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Elixir-Charnel-Gourmand-Coquin-4675.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4675.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elixir Charnel Gourmand Coquin"title="Elixir Charnel Gourmand Coquin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1624339ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1624339" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297099">Perpetual Collector</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-15">08/15/22 15:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@drrobinson04, my exp.with this one is exactly the same, but i do not think it relates to weather, since i live in tge dry desert. On one occasion it will last 12 hours and project like a monster, but 3 days later it will disapear in 15 minutes. On the "good day" i will receive compliments, but none on the "bad day" which tells me nobody can smell it on me either. Baccarat is always nuclear on me, so i am not sure what is in this one that makes it so unpredictable. However, moody or not, it is one of the best fumes i had a pleasure of smelling.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1624339"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1624339#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1624153" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1624153" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="drrobinson04"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1316612"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="drrobinson04" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Guidance-78656.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78656.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Guidance"title="Guidance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1624153ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1624153" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1316612">drrobinson04</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-15">08/15/22 09:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance on me is unpredictable! The first day I received it it was 90+ degrees outside. It arrived midday  and I was excited, so I immediately sprayed on hot skin. One spray each wrist. BOOM! The fragrance danced around me and I could smell enchanted litchi aquatic musk for the rest of the day about 6 hours while I moved around. The next day I sprayed it on me fresh out of the shower all pulse points with Unscented lotion. I could only smell it for 10 minutes unless I buried my nose in my skin. It did not budge past a skin scent. Another day I tried it scented lotion with similar notes And still could only smell it up close on skin and on clothes.( It is rainy today and in the 70s. I tried on skin washed in the evening since it performed better last time on skin that was not right out of the shower. I am not sure about projection, but no one has noticed, typically at least one person will compliment or be curious. Nothing. My husband also could not smell it. What happened to the first day fragrance? Does it need to be 90+ To return to a 10/10 on me? Ive heard that anosmia can happen with this fragrance. I do not go anosmic to BR540 which this one is compared to, but prefer the warmer femme leaning  fruity quality of Greenwich. I do not smell the note similarities, however the fragrance behavior on some is congruent. To me it is a wild, puzzling ride. Greenwich  is by far the most Reactive on me to changes to pH, environment, and other body care items Ive ever experienced. Moody, and currently ghosting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1624153"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1624153#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1614157" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/785204">Miss.Tara</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-03">07/03/22 23:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow, I forget how much I love the airy texture of ambroxin. This is BR 540 without the sweetness or saffron, but with added. . . zest? It smells fresh and uplifting. And for 12+ hours! after 6 hours, I felt I needed to layer this with something. Not because it was fading, but I assume after 6 hours, it's not going to develop anymore. I wanted to continue with the freshness, so I layered Chanel No19 EDT. 6 hours later, No19 is long gone and here is Greenwich village smelling like I *just* sprayed it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1587495" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Smellgoodallthetime"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362385"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Smellgoodallthetime" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-Exclusif-50370.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50370.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina Exclusif"title="Delina Exclusif"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1587495ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1587495" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362385">Smellgoodallthetime</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-19">06/19/22 10:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is ambergris paired with a citrus to me. I love baccarat for the ambergris. This is also an ambergris bomb (to be technical its actually ambroxin). But more every-occasion friendly.<br />
<br />
Edit after the dry down of about 20 minutes. The mixture has a bit of a woody note as well which is kind of dirties it and is a bit off putting to me. So Im marking it as just ok; not a like or love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1587495"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1587495#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1586261" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1586261" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="akay.lee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1514666"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="akay.lee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1586261ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1586261" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1514666">akay.lee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-17">06/17/22 09:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Truly was not a fan of this scent at first. In the initial spray, the musk is so heavy that it almost comes across as dirty fruit. <br />
<br />
BUT<br />
 <br />
after letting it dry down for about 45 minutes, the musk almost completely fades &amp; youre left with a sweet, fresh scent. Luckily the freshness isnt cleaning product fresh but a gardenlike freshness thats faint under the sweetness of this perfume. <br />
<br />
Definitely a scent with layers &amp; is very wearable. I wouldnt call it a staple the same way id call Tribeca a staple</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1586261"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1586261#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1586179" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1586179" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maleficent&#039;s cotton candy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461326"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1461326.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maleficent&#039;s cotton candy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Sycomore-Eau-de-Parfum-41780.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41780.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sycomore Eau de Parfum"title="Sycomore Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1586179ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1586179" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461326">Maleficent&#039;s cotton candy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-17">06/17/22 07:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I sampled this when I was looking for a sweet, fresh citrusy musk with the Byredo Sundazed vibe. The opening was very sweet and citrusy. Orange Marmalade with a little lemon zest. 6 hours later, I found myself wondering what smelled like BR 540. It was this. As strong as possible. Faded citrus. No freshness. But as though I applied BR in the same spot on my wrist. Seeing the other reviews is validating. This, somehow, is still a heavier sweetness than BR, if thats what youre looking for. Sundazed has a fabric softener freshness that this lacks. Sundazed has nowhere near this staying power, though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1586179"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1586179#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1585359" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It reminds me so much of both. If you're on the fence, get the Ariana Grande Cloud it's very similar! I won't be buying the full bottle of this since I already have MFK BR.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1581869"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1581869#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1556200" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1556200" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Perpetual Collector"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297099"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1297099.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Perpetual Collector" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Elixir-Charnel-Gourmand-Coquin-4675.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4675.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elixir Charnel Gourmand Coquin"title="Elixir Charnel Gourmand Coquin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1556200ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1556200" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297099">Perpetual Collector</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-03">05/03/22 11:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I reviewed this in January, after wearing my sample. I stated I was not sure about getting a full bottle of it, but yeah...i shelled out big bucks for it. I am in love with it so bad, that you could pretty much take all my fumes away as long as you leave me this, De Profundis and Shaghaf Oud. Greenwich  Village turned into a must-have for me after I wore my sample for two weeks straight and kept getting compliments on it left and right. There were quite a few instances where I'd spray two sprays and not be able to smell anything, which was the reason I held off since January. I am not sure what the reason for that is other than varying skin PH, but there will be days when you won't be able to smell this on yourself, which doesn't mean that others can't. Other days, good days, it will last more than 18 hours, and chances are you will wake up still smelling of it.<br />
Greenwich Village does beat Baccarat by a mile, mostly due to freshness, and it will pull more compliments from those around you. However, they are distinct enough to be able to tell them apart, once again, due to the fresher, lighter aspect of GV.<br />
Is it pricey? Sure is! But so is your coffee at Starbucks.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1556200"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1556200#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1549531" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is pretty nice!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1549531"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1549531#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1549025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1549025" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jeandeaux"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1351640"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1351640.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jeandeaux" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Imagination-67370.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67370.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Imagination"title="Imagination"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1549025ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1549025" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1351640">Jeandeaux</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-23">04/23/22 00:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Good god... this one is a radioactive supernova just like the bottle implies. I need to give it more try but first need time to forget its heavy syrupy spectre.<br />
<br />
Edit: okay this is heading towards a dangerous, addictive territory. I feel like a grade a bitch wearing this in all her glory. A bitch babe drinking a pina colada alongside a Vegas pool.<br />
<br />
Go easy on this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1549025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1549025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1545990" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1545990" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lairdumoi1892"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305726"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1305726.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lairdumoi1892" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Do-Son-Eau-de-Toilette-6501.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6501.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Do Son Eau de Toilette"title="Do Son Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1545990ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1545990" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305726">lairdumoi1892</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-18">04/18/22 13:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Was very excited to try this one, but unfortunately felt quite disappointed. The beginning felt sweet in a very direct and unuanced manner, I did not get the freshness described in the notes, as the flowery aspect felt limp and sugary, I expected this to be a bit more airy, maybe the florals like in inflorescence by Byredo. Maybe will have to go back to giving it a bit more time and said by many in the reviews, but for now this smelt like a designer fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; The real experience of GV starts about 30 minutes after spraying it. From a sweet flat scent it develops into a deep Mysterious unexplained fragrance. This is very complex to me. Its like a beautiful sexy actress who plays different rolls in a show. Its the same women but different personalities. Shes playing you. In a seductive manner.<br />
I love it. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1530513" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cyllde"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312369"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1312369.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cyllde" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1530513ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1530513" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312369">Cyllde</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-25">03/25/22 18:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I see that a lot of people compare this to BR540 and I can pick up a slight similarity.<br />
This is BR540 if they decided to make a spring fresh version. It's probably why I loved it at first sniff. It's fresh and clean. Super long lasting. One spray on my wrist, under my hoodie and the wind was picking it up so well. A lady asked me what I was wearing. Said I smelled fresh out of the shower. It's a forever staple. The price is crazy. I'm not a fan of the lid. It's plastic and squeaky when you turn it. For the price they could have made the cap magnetic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1530513"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1530513#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1523673" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Less heavy. Love both!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1506323"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1506323#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1505466" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1505466" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="savsher"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1406884"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="savsher" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1505466ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1505466" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1406884">savsher</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-16">02/16/22 08:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Greenwich Village is airy, aquatic, sweet, and alluring. It definitely has a femme energy. This scent is entirely unique and I've never smelled anything like it despite having a pretty massive library of samples. I haven't had a chance to wear it in public much, but I imagine it would be a crowd-pleaser. <br />
<br />
I own a bottle of Greenwich Village as well as Cloud and BR540 and definitely do not find it to be a dupe of either. Yes, there is something of the BR540 DNA in Greenwich Village, but personally I find the end result to be entirely different. Whereas BR540 is warm, GV is predominantly fresh. While I think Greenwich Village could be a year-round scent for some, I live in an area with very cold winters and don't imagine reaching for it until spring. <br />
<br />
Performance (on me) is excellent and long-lasting. That being said, I think the price is pretty outlandish and absolutely would not pay full price for a bottle. Wait for the discounters to have it in stock!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1505466"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1505466#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1504317" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1504317" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nelsongil13"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030706"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1030706.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nelsongil13" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Sauvage-Eau-de-Parfum-48100.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48100.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sauvage Eau de Parfum"title="Sauvage Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1504317ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1504317" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030706">nelsongil13</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-14">02/14/22 15:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>GREENWICH VILLAGE by the AMERICAN niche house BOND No 9 <br />
<br />
This fragrance is SO BEAUTIFUL in every inch, starting with its stunning Acqua marine bottle design. <br />
<br />
Unisex with a parade of TROPICAL FRUITS, FLORAL and VANILLA delicacy. <br />
I get a glorious sweet Cotton candy vibe with a tiny aquatic nuance. <br />
A Turn head effect smell that will makes you the best smelling person not only in the block but in your country. <br />
70% Female/ 30% unisex <br />
Appealing and playful for special occasion during the cooler days of the year. <br />
<br />
Note: sillage is beastly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1504317"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1504317#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1504052" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
