padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1501096" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fragrancelover90210"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1457484"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="fragrancelover90210" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1501096ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1501096" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1457484">fragrancelover90210</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-09">02/09/22 15:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is one of the most beautiful scents Ive ever smelled.<br />
To me, its very dessert like (praline, caramel, vanilla) + a fresh component. You won't smell anything much floral. This can be used all year around, night and day. <br />
<br />
HOWEVER, I will not buy this again.<br />
Smell is a 10/10<br />
however stays barely 30 minutes on me with a very weak sillage.<br />
Do not blind buy this one-get a sample first and TRY IT ON YOUR SKIN first!! See the longevity on your skin before you buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1501096"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1501096#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1494224" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1494224" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Erica.Cass"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234317"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Erica.Cass" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pharrell-Williams/Girl-25524.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25524.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Girl"title="Girl"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1494224ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1494224" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234317">Erica.Cass</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-30">01/30/22 11:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favorite! Never want to be without it in my collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1494224"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1494224#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1487001" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1487001" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Emilie02"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1376147"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Emilie02" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54157.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Greenwich Village"title="Greenwich Village"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1487001ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1487001" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1376147">Emilie02</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-20">01/20/22 04:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At the initial blast, you can sense a similarity to br540, but they are nothing alike imo. This is sweet, yet fresh. It feels expensive, but there is something that smells synthetic to me and tbh, I don't really like that. It reminds me of Burberry her without the strawberry, but still has that synthetic fruity vibe...<br />
<br />
Edit: I absolutely love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1487001"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1487001#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1480565" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1480565" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Perpetual Collector"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297099"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1297099.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Perpetual Collector" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Elixir-Charnel-Gourmand-Coquin-4675.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4675.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elixir Charnel Gourmand Coquin"title="Elixir Charnel Gourmand Coquin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1480565ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1480565" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1297099">Perpetual Collector</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-10">01/10/22 20:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Stunning. Almost similar to my beloved BR 540, but way more wearable. For some reason, one single spray of BR 540 under my shirt, causes my entire household a sleepless night. We can't figure out why, but we usually all toss and turn on nights following a day of my BR 540 wear.  It came to the point where my husband literally begs me not to wear Baccarat. <br />
Greenwich seem a tad lighter, although it is similar enough where it would be very difficult for me justifying spending 400 bucks on a bottle. For some reason, no discounter websites carry this as of today. At this point, it costs more than i paid for BR 540, so it will take few more wears from my official sample to figure out if Greenwich is worth the big bucks they're asking for it. Untrained nose with familiarity to Baccarat Rouge would never be able to tell the difference.<br />
Anyhow, i hope we all get some sleep tonight.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1480565"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1480565#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1478398" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1478398" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="angelala"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1420392"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1420392.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="angelala" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1478398ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1478398" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1420392">angelala</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-07">01/07/22 12:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is like if Cloud and Baccarat Rouge had a baby and then gave it a bath and I'm here for it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1478398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1478398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="54157" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1221530" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1221530" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="piyux"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1230413"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1230413.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="piyux" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dior-Homme-Intense-2011-13016.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13016.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dior Homme Intense 2011"title="Dior Homme Intense 2011"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1221530ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1221530" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1230413">piyux</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-09-07">09/07/20 18:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bond No 9 Greenwich Village EDP opens with a strong projection of sweet, musky, citrus, fruity, floral, and gourmand notes. The opening is intense, projecting, well-balanced, and very pleasant. The mandarin orange contributes with a sweet citrusy touch but its presence is short-lived, it comes and goes very fast. The cassis or black is a dark fruity, musky, with a light animalic touch, a sharpening musky note, that also enhances other notes. The litchi brings a very aromatic fruity touch, with a cherry-like accord. The peony, water lily, and jasmine blend their notes to create a noticeable white floral touch. The ambroxan is there to project and its musky touch blends with the musk note in this fragrance. The combination of the ambroxan and the musk creates an ambery accord, musky without being offensive or animalic, but very projecting with a soft powdery touch. The praline and vanilla are the last notes, a gourmand, sweet, a milky-chocolate-like accord. The only noticeable opening to a dry-down change in this fragrance is, the opening and ephemeral mandarin orange note, that comes up for a brief moment, and the ambery development towards the dry-down, once the ambroxan and musk have settled down. Once Bond No 9 Greenwich Village EDP has reached its full dry-down, it can be summarized as a moderate projection, very sweet gourmand (vanilla, praline), musky (ambroxan, musk), white floral (Peony, Water Lily, Jasmine), and fruity (litchi) fragrance. The fragrance feels bold, candy-sweet, comforting, cozy, delectable, dense, dry, elegant, energizing, exotic, expensive, floral, formal, fragrant, fruity (dark fruits-like), gourmand (milk with a bit of chocolate), high-quality, imposing, intense, inviting, mature, milky, modern, musky (not animalic or dirty, instead ambery with a slight powdery touch), nicely-blended, playful, slightly powdery, resinous, refined, rich, romantic, special, very sweet, syrupy, unique, unisex, versatile, and very pleasant.<br />
<br />
BATCH REVIEWED: 2020 (#10620).<br />
WOW RATING: 10/10. A very well-developed and impressive fragrance.<br />
DISLIKE RATING: 2/10. The fragrance is very sweet and floral.<br />
UNIQUENESS: 10/10. The notes and resulting scent are unique, the fragrance uses notes that are not frequently found in other fragrances creating a unique and easy to recognize aroma.<br />
MASS APPEAL: 9/10. This is a fragrance that most people will enjoy.<br />
PROJECTION: 4/10. Moderate, about 4 feet around the wearer.<br />
SILLAGE: 6/10. Very good, about 6 feet behind the wearer.<br />
APPLICATION: 4 to 6 atomizations.<br />
LONGEVITY: 6/10. Very good, about 6 hours, it projects for about 3 hours.<br />
SEASONS: Winter, spring, summer, fall, colder days, and climate-controlled environments.<br />
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, gym, office, business, casual, holidays, vacations, romantic, dating, clubbing. This is an office-friendly fragrance. <br />
VERSATILITY: 10/10. A highly versatile fragrance ideal for any time of the year and any occasion.<br />
GENDER: Advertised as unisex, the fragrance contains noticeable floral accords which create a slight tilt to the feminine side. Yet, it is closer to a unisex to a feminine fragrance.<br />
AGES: 30 and above.<br />
RECOMMENDATION: Bond No 9 Greenwich Village EDP can be purchased for about $170, it is a fragrance a bit on the pricy side, but its quality, uniqueness, and scent are worth. This fragrance is ideal for those that appreciate unisex notes. This is a great buy.<br />
BLIND-BUY: No, sample it first, the floral notes could be perceived as too feminine.<br />
SIMILAR: These are examples of fragrances in the same genre. Alt Fragrances Crystal Intense No 32 is a clone of MFK Baccarat Rough 540 Extrait; <br />
Alt Fragrances Crystal No 23 is a clone of MFK Baccarat Rouge 540 EDP; Dua Fragrances Casino Royale Nights is a clone of MFK Baccarat Rough 540 Extrait; MFK Baccarat Rouge 540 EDP is a very sweet, resinous, woody, floral, and musky; MFK Baccarat Rough 540 Extrait is a sweet ambery, almond, musky, woody, and spicy fragrance; AllSaints Sunset Riot is a very sweet, amber, orange blossom, and pink pepper fragrance; Bond No 9 Greenwich Village EDP is a fantastic, very sweet gourmand vanilla, praline, musk, ambroxan, white floral peony, water lily, jasmine, and litchi fragrance.<br />
SUMMARY: A moderate projection, very sweet gourmand (vanilla, praline), musky (ambroxan, musk), white floral (Peony, Water Lily, Jasmine), and fruity (litchi) fragrance. The fragrance feels bold, candy-sweet, comforting, cozy, delectable, dense, dry, elegant, energizing, exotic, expensive, floral, formal, fragrant, fruity (dark fruits-like), gourmand (milk with a bit of chocolate), high-quality, imposing, intense, inviting, mature, milky, modern, musky (not animalic or dirty, instead ambery with a slight powdery touch), nicely-blended, playful, slightly powdery, resinous, refined, rich, romantic, special, very sweet, syrupy, unique, unisex, versatile, and very pleasant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1221530"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1221530#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1449009" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1449009" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aroma babe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/876995"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.876995.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aroma babe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Aura-Mugler-Eau-de-Parfum-Sensuelle-54977.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54977.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aura Mugler Eau de Parfum Sensuelle"title="Aura Mugler Eau de Parfum Sensuelle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1449009ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1449009" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/876995">Aroma babe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-19">11/19/21 20:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Holy shit!!! This stuff is amazing!!!  seriously I own over 100 fragrances and this literally blows most of them out of the water (obviously in its own category) this scent is indescribable its so beautiful. Its sweet candy-ish but I cant put my finger on it to describe the notes. I just came home to my package as I was opening it and sprayed it on to my arm to test it (cause I have a habit of blind buying) I hadnt gotten a whiff of it yet, then I hear my husband say fuck that smells good at that second I get it too and Im blown away. Ive been a big fragrance addict for a while now but recently Ive become a perfume snob where fragrances like this one makes it ok to burn a whole in my wallet, and Im ABSOLUTELY ok with it! If youre wallet sounds like mine try this, I promise you will love it like I do.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1449009"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1449009#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1831780" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1831780" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LeslieM"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399182"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1399182.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LeslieM" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Valaya-78574.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78574.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Valaya"title="Valaya"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1831780ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1831780" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399182">LeslieM</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-12">05/12/23 20:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Will never be without this fragrance. I didn't understand the hype when I tried it at the store but I kept thinking about it so eventually bought a bottle.  I can't ever get enough of this. I try not to use it too much because I want to use so many of my other lovely scents, but this is an easy reach for me. I get compliments every time I wear this and it leaves a deliciously fresh scent trail.  I have the most love for this scent when I haven't worn it for a minute. It's like I fall in love with it all over again. There is nothing else in my collection like GV. To my nose this does not smell like BR540 and I don't get the comparisons. If anything Tribeca from Bond has a slight similarity on first spray only. But that beast is an incredible creation of its own.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1831780"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1831780#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1084318" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1084318" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pennypencil"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7840"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7840.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pennypencil" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Victoria-Beckham-Beauty/21-50-Reverie-97667.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.97667.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="21:50 Rverie"title="21:50 Rverie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1084318ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1084318" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7840">pennypencil</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-03">08/03/19 06:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Insane price, and more fun and sexy than expensive-smelling. I think it's probably hard to make lychee smell expensive. It does however smell wonderful and lasts for moons. This really does stick around in exactly the same way Baccarat Rouge does and I totally get the comparison. They have a very similar sweet, sticky, musky vibe that hangs around the wearer in a halo. It's the kind of creamy warmth you might get from a melted lollipop on clean laundry. But on top of that, I also get the smell of nights out in resort nightclubs: the sweet smell of millennial men, tropical fruit cocktails and the aroma of hot sun having warmed skin all day long. Incredibly appealing, sweetly unisex and boldly modern. Also shares some DNA with Ford Metallique. Addictive.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1084318"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1084318#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1042230" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1042230" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="360Logic"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1130851"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1130851.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="360Logic" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Stephane-Humbert-Lucas-777/God-of-Fire-72381.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72381.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="God of Fire"title="God of Fire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1042230ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1042230" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1130851">360Logic</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-18">03/18/19 10:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I actually tried this at Saks last week (3/15/19). It seems pretty obvious that this is Bond's answer to Baccarat Rouge. I mentioned that to the sales associate and she tried to convince me that it isn't and that it's "very different on the drydown," but I call shenanigans. I still have my spray card and they are indeed very similar all the way through. I do have to admit, however, that I think I like this better. It's a little brighter, less cotton candy sweet and less of that synthetic ambergris/Ambrox that is like the glitter herpes of fragrances (once it's on your fabric it never comes off). It's not so much of an expensive clone as yet another Bond take on a popular theme, ala Bondno9.com (aventusesque), Chez Bond (GITesque), etc.<br />
<br />
Also, lol Bond prices! I'm all for paying a little more in store sometimes since you know the item is fresh and you often get a bunch of extra stuff, not to mention personal service, but hell if I'm ever paying two or three hundred dollars more than what their bottles end up costing at discounters. Either way, this and Lafayette street are actually pretty good efforts and worthy of consideration, after adjusting for price.<br />
<br />
Update: it's been over two weeks now and I can't stop smelling my sample card. If the price for this ever comes down into the realm of mere mortals, it'll probably be on my short list for a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1042230"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1042230#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="54157" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1980061" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="warmcashmere"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1879178"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1879178.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="warmcashmere" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1980061ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1980061" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1879178">warmcashmere</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-19">11/19/23 05:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When you first spray it, it smells like BR540 for about 2 seconds. Then, it completely changes. It takes on a blue, water-like scent that I think leans more masculine. I don't mind the way it smells on me, but I think I'd like it more on a man. Scent lasts a long time on my skin, which is rare for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1980061"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1980061#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1350614" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1350614" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FrescoScents"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1292324"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1292324.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FrescoScents" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1350614ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1350614" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1292324">FrescoScents</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-28">05/28/21 09:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Paid 5 dollars for a decant, glad I didn't blind buy. Wanted to like it but it smells like mop water.<br />
<br />
Update: (6 hours later) I'm not a fan of the opening but golly the drydown is very pleasant.  Overall is overpriced in my humble opinion but it's a good BKR540 inspired fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1350614"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1350614#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1799315" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1799315" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LizMango"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1477269"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1477269.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LizMango" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elie-Saab/Le-Parfum-12258.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12258.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Parfum"title="Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1799315ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1799315" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1477269">LizMango</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-03">04/03/23 07:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first spray is so exciting but I hate the dry down. I really tried. I went through two samples because I wanted to love it and get the gorgeous bottle. It makes me feel musty! It is fresh but not clean, like sour playdoh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="54157"comment_id="1799315"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Greenwich-Village-54157.html?ccid=1799315#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="54157" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="54157":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="54157" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300 __728x90" id="fragranticacom_perfume_footer" v-pre>

            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ro").replace(/designers/, "creatori").replace(/perfume/, "parfum") });
                if (lang == 'AR') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragranticarabia.com").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'UK') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.ua").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'MN') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.mn").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
                if (lang == 'HE') $("a.en2inter").attr("href", function () {
            return this.href.replace(/www.fragrantica.com/, "www.fragrantica.co.il").replace(/perfume/, "perfumes") });
            });
</script>


<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('#fragranticaloader').fadeOut(20);
    });
</script>
</body>
</html>
